result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Dale Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Dale Smith in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE entered plea of NC.  Court finds defendant guilty count 1.  State tendered victim impact stmt.  

COURT:  Count 1 - Sentence w/held probation 1 year - NO contact with Darrell O'shogay - AODA and any follow thru - Costs $453.00 -  credit 1 day time served -  restitution has been paid of $350.00 to Clerk of Courts for the victim  any counseling DOC may impose  - counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts

Defendant Thomas Dale Smith in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail continues  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas Dale Smith in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. has not contacted atty yet, contact PD today  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas Dale Smith in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.   DEF enters NG Plea on Counts 1-3, court accepts.   SIBS  $1000  No Contact with Darrell O'Shogay  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
